title: John and Betty's Scotch history visit,
author: Williamson, Margaret. [from old catalog]
snippet: On through towns and between fields of grain it hurried them. They whirled through Lauder, where Archibald Douglas, or " Bell the Cat," of Tantallon Castle,  seized and promptly hanged Cochrane, a worthless favorite of King James III; they caught sight of the fifteenth-century keep of Crichton Castle on the right and, on their left, of Borthwick Castle, with a room in which Queen Mary and Bothwell once passed the night. Then it seemed but a very short time until familiar Arthur's Seat appeared before them, and they left the train at the Waverley Station.
